reviews.review_msg: if you get an educ471 with him, drop it and take it another year with a different prof. other educ471 setup is mostly weekly discussions and about 5000-7000 words total. Senyshyn's version - 19,700 words. if you end up with this guy, pray you are graded by his very nice TA instead of a 74-year-old who is too senile to use Canvas.

There is so many things that I could say about this prof but the most recent reviews really summarize how unbelievably horrible he is. In 4 years of post-secondary studies at Douglas, SFU, and KPU, this prof is by far the worst one I've unfortunately had the misfortune of taking! In layman terms, this guy embodies the meme "Old man yells at cloud"

Assigns 3-4 papers every week and made us buy his own book that has nothing to do with curriculum. We read the same 3 books every week and write the same essays every week and still learn nothing. Also scared to reach out for clarification cause he deducts marks if you do.

I have never experienced such disrespect from a prof. If you explain that you are struggling with the intense workload (16,000+ words), he will say to stop complaining & get back to work. No guidance, support, or compassion. I am in school to be a teacher and this was a great example of what not to become. The TA was lovely though.

At the beginning of the course, I had thought this class would be straight forward. Syllabus only states that there will be 1 assignment per week, worth 100% of your grade. After the deadline to drop, assignments got way harder. He assigned 14,000+ mandatory words throughout the semester & tons of reading. He is also very rude. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Believes it's not insane giving 3-4 1000 word reflections per week. When you bring up the workload concern with him, his response is, "you got exactly what you signed up for, stop complaining." Of course, asking questions doesn't come without risk as well because he also threatens to deduct marks if you email him a "stupid question". AVOID THIS MAN

Beginning of sem: I am a nicr prof who wont give you a lot of work.

End of sem: 4 mandatory papers per week , "dont complain its useless"
the easiest one in 4 level educ course

Completely shameless with the promotion of his own music. Lessons frequently degenerated into long-winded stories of personal experiences.  It's a strange class, he is obviously very intelligent but his self-absorption is hard to choke down, I grew to really dislike this class
